message: who are you most excited to see portrayed on screen?
I just caught wind of this show. Amazing.
I loved Jon Snow while reading the book, but I'm conflicted about the guy playing him. I hope he does the character justice.
Beat me to it. If Dinklage can pull off even half of Tyrion's dry wit I'll be happy.
from the books I also love (well, love to hate) Cersei
I'm kind of excited about Tyrion because Peter Dinklage is rather awesome
@leah Tyrion looks to be awesome. Eddard Stark and Jon Snow also look great. I really would love to see Theon Greyjoy & Melisandre, but I guess we'll have to wait for future seasons...
Speaking of Melisandre, can we just cast Christina Hendricks now?
Ned and Tyrion were cast perfectly!
@leah Definitely Tyrion for me too. Though the one character I think they "nailed" more than any of the other is Tywin Lannister, he looks exactly like I've always imagined him.
@jeffrock I could totally see Tricia Helfer do Melisandre as well. She did audition for Cersei, and is a huge fan of the books.
Honestly it's a tough call. There are so many good ones! John Snow and Tyrion for sure. But, I also like Daenerys's whole story arc too.
and that's exactly why rr martin is a sonofabitch
my favorite characters are everyone in dance
pretty excited to see jon snow on screen
i love the scrappy punk => badass transformation story
Just a younger version
He so looks like him

Brothers separated at birth
I actually thought Jaime was cast very well http://blastr.com/2009/08/nikolaj-coster-waldau-joi.php
also @kneath he does not look much like dennis leary

arg

That whole last scene with the line, "The things I do for love." and him pushing to boy out the window, that's the only reason I am watching the next episode.  Just barely peeked my interest to the level where I am willing to watch more.

@thauber A majority of the critics have said that the pilot is the weakest episode (they've been sent the first 6), there's just too many characters to introduce to get any good pace going. It should only get better. Don't judge the series just based on this first one. The books are the same, it only gets better.
sounds good

@samuellinde I am definitely going to give it more chances just because it comes with such high recommendation.  I really want to like it. I need a good fantasy/medieval show in the mix.  I was being a little hyperbolic when I said "the only reason".

Peter Dinklage did an awesome job as Tyrion Lannister. Looking forward to see more of him. I am also looking forward to Arya Stark growing up and putting the needle in Joffrey's throat.  I am currently reading the series, so my likes may change.
snow =]
Snow

I really love to read about Arya Aventures.. but in the last book Bran role was really great I think that was the high point of the book.. it was a pity that Daenerys and her Dragons don't had more emphasis.. and Tyrion he is just awesome.. not really a evil guy but at the same time is not nice one, I think that he is one of the character that may amaze us all at the end..
Tyrion and daenary
